Description: Large amphora; earthenware; buff fabric; wet-combed ribbed ware; rounded base gradually tapering to a point; ovoid body, high neck, with everted rim; two applied handles on shoulders.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1993 1 Apr-7 May, Oxford, Ashmolean Museum, The Byzantium Bridge between East & West: Trade & Manufacture 300-1453 AD
Acquisition name: Purchased from: B A Seaby Ltd
